solution_line_template: There is {saturdays_per_week} Saturday in a week and there are {weeks_per_month} weeks in a month so there are {saturdays_per_week} * {weeks_per_month}= <<{saturdays_per_week}*{weeks_per_month}={saturdays_in_month}>>{saturdays_in_month} Saturdays in a month (on average)

If Kantana buys herself {chocolates_for_self_per_saturday} chocolates every Saturday then this means she buys {chocolates_for_self_per_saturday} * {saturdays_in_month}=<<{chocolates_for_self_per_saturday}*{saturdays_in_month}={chocolates_for_self_per_month}>>{chocolates_for_self_per_month} chocolates for herself for the month.

Kantana also buys her sister {chocolates_for_sister_per_saturday} chocolate on these trips so she is picking up an additional {chocolates_for_sister_per_saturday}* {saturdays_in_month}=<<{chocolates_for_sister_per_saturday}*{saturdays_in_month}={chocolates_for_sister_per_month}>>{chocolates_for_sister_per_month} additional chocolates for her sister for the month.

Kantana decided to also purchase some chocolates for her friend Charlie for his birthday. She bought Charlie {chocolates_for_charlie} chocolates. This means that for the month she bought {chocolates_for_charlie} chocolates for Charlie, {chocolates_for_sister_per_month} chocolates for her sister, and {chocolates_for_self_per_month} chocolates for herself, {chocolates_for_charlie}+{chocolates_for_sister_per_month}+{chocolates_for_self_per_month}= <<{chocolates_for_charlie}+{chocolates_for_sister_per_month}+{chocolates_for_self_per_month}={total_chocolates_bought}>>{total_chocolates_bought} chocolates bought in total for the month.
